In this area the rhumb line and great circle between two positions situated in this area practically coincide.

On a conformal chart, scale is

options.text: constant along a parallel of latitude.
constant along a meridian of longitude.
variable; it varies as a function of latitude and longitude.

variant.question: A great-circle track is drawn on a Lambert chart between positions A and B in the Northern Hemisphere. If the parallel of origin of the Lambert chart is 37^o^ , what is the longitude difference between positions A and B?

options.text: is an area within which the actual scale of the chart differs only by less than 1% from the stated chart scale.
is an area in which the true track of departure and the true track of arrival are practically identical.
is an area where the rhumb line and great circle connections between two points are almost identical.
